oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Horses; Soldiers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Horse-drawn carriage travelling past stone monuments on Kelly Field in Chickamauga National Military Park. Closest statue commemorates the 7th Virginia Infantry.; The reverse side lists the postcard as "no. 2176, Chattanooga, Tenn."
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Raphael Tuck and Sons was a British company that printed books, postcards, and greeting cards between the mid 1800s to the destruction of the publishing house during the Blitz in World War II.; Tuck postcards entered the U.S. market in 1900. The postcards are highly valued by collectors.
